page.title: 03Trays Farm,Compton Dundon.2
page.content: This is predominantly a dairy farm with 80 friesians. Each cow yields 5500 litres of milk per year which is sold exclusively to the Milk Marketing Board. The few beef cattle are either taken to the abbatoirs or to market, whichever will pay the higher price. Animal feedstuffs such as rape, silage and hay are grown. There are some cereal crops grown although they are not as significant as in former years. The grassland is intensively farmed and they use 30 tonnes of artificial fertilizer every year.
